Creation timestamps: {{yes}}{{efn |Implemented in later versions as an extension}}

Last metadata change timestamps: {{no}}{{efn |name=fat-ctime |Some FAT implementations, such as in Linux, show file modification timestamp (mtime) in the metadata change timestamp (ctime) field. This timestamp is however, not updated on file metadata change.}}
Extended attributes/ Alternate data stre: {{no}}{{efn |name=note-22 |Particular Installable File System drivers and operating systems may not support extended attributes on FAT12 and FAT16. The OS/2 and Windows NT filesystem drivers for FAT12 and FAT16 support extended attributes (using a "EA DATA. SF" pseudo-file to reserve the clusters allocated to them). Other filesystem drivers for other operating systems do not.}}

Stores file owner: {{yes}}{{efn |name=note-14 |The f-node contains a field for a user identifier. This is not used except by OS/2 Warp Server, however.}}

POSIX file permissions: {{yes}}{{efn |name=note-5 |NTFS access control lists can express any access policy possible using simple POSIX file permissions (and far more), but use of a POSIX-like interface is not supported without an add-on such as Services for UNIX or Cygwin.}}
Security/ MAC labels: {{yes}}{{efn |As of Vista, NTFS has support for Mandatory Labels, which are used to enforce Mandatory Integrity Control.[27]}}

Extended attributes/ Alternate data stre: {{yes}}{{efn |Initially, ReFS lacked support for ADS, but Server 2012 R2 and up add support for ADS on ReFS}}

Access control lists: {{yes}}{{efn |name=note-33 |Access-control lists and MAC labels are layered on top of extended attributes.}}
Extended attributes/ Alternate data stre: {{no}}{{efn |name=note-32 |Some operating systems implemented extended attributes as a layer over UFS1 with a parallel backing file (e.g., FreeBSD 4.x).}}

Access control lists: {{yes}}{{efn |name=note-23 |Some Installable File System drivers and operating systems may not support extended attributes, access control lists or security labels on these filesystems. Linux kernels prior to 2.6.x may either be missing support for these altogether or require a patch.}}

Creation timestamps: {{partial}}{{efn |name=note-35 |Creation time stored since June 2015, xfsprogs version 3.2.3}}
Checksum/ ECC: {{partial}}{{efn |name=note-34 |Metadata checksums stored since June 2015, xfsprogs version 3.2.3}}

Creation timestamps: {{yes}}{{efn |name=note-31 |The local time, timezone/UTC offset, and date are derived from the time settings of the reference/single timesync source in the NDS tree.}}
Extended attributes/ Alternate data stre: {{yes}}{{efn |name=note-19 |Novell calls this feature "multiple data streams". Published specifications say that NWFS allows for 16 attributes and 10 data streams, and NSS allows for unlimited quantities of both.}}{{efn |name=note-29 |Some file and directory metadata is stored on the NetWare server irrespective of whether Directory Services is installed or not, like date/time of creation, file size, purge status, etc
Checksum/ ECC: and some file and directory metadata is stored in NDS/eDirectory, like file/object permissions, ownership, etc.}}

Extended attributes/ Alternate data stre: {{yes}}{{efn |name=note-17 |Record Management Services (RMS) attributes include record type and size, among many others.}}

POSIX file permissions: {{yes}}{{efn |name=note-61 |File permission in 9P are a variation of the traditional Unix permissions with some minor changes, e.g. the suid bit is replaced by a new 'exclusive access' bit.}}

Security/ MAC labels: {{yes}}{{efn |name=note-69 |Supported on FreeBSD and Linux implementations, support may not be available on all operating systems.}}
Extended attributes/ Alternate data stre: {{yes}}{{efn |name=note-60 |Solaris "extended attributes" are really full-blown alternate data streams, in both the Solaris UFS and ZFS.}}

Checksum/ ECC: {{yes}}{{efn | disabling copy-on-write (COW) to prevent fragmentation also disables checksumming}}

Last access/ read timestamps: {{yes}}{{efn|Access times are preserved from the original file system at creation time, but Rock Ridge file systems themselves are read-only.}}
Access control lists: {{no}}{{efn|libburnia can backup and restore ACLs with file system creation and extraction programs, but no kernel support exists.}}
Security/ MAC labels: {{no}}{{efn|name=note-78|libburnia can backup and restore extended attributes and MAC labels with file system creation and extraction programs, but no kernel support exists.}}

Extended attributes/ Alternate data stre: Extended attributes/ Alternate data streams/ forks
